text: Jonah Is Angry at Yahweh’s Compassion

And this\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Hebrew “it” \f* ⸤was greatly displeasing⸥\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Literally “was displeasing \fq with \ft great displeasure” \f* to Jonah, and ⸤he became furious⸥.\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Literally “it was hot for him” \f*

And he prayed to Yahweh and said, “O Yahweh, \add was\add* this not ⸤what I said⸥\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Literally “my word” \f* while I was in my homeland? Therefore ⸤I originally fled⸥\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Literally “I did the first time to flee” \f* to Tarshish, because I knew that you \add are\add* a gracious and compassionate God, slow to anger ⸤and having great steadfast love⸥,\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Literally “and great of steadfast love” \f* and one who relents concerning calamity.\f + \fr 4:2 \ft That is, calamity sent by God as judgment \f*
And so then, Yahweh, please take my life from me, because \add for\add* me death \add is\add* better than life!”

And Yahweh said, “⸤Is it right for you to be angry⸥?”\f + \fr 4:4 \ft Literally “Rightfully is it hot for you”; some take this to mean “Are you so very angry?” (\fqa Targum \ft \xt Jonah 4:4; \ft see also JPS, NEB, NET) \f*

And Jonah went out from the city and sat \add down\add* east of the city, and he made for himself a shelter there. And he sat under it in the shade, ⸤waiting to see⸥\f + \fr 4:5 \ft Literally “until he would see” \f* what would happen with the city.

And Yahweh God appointed a plant,\f + \fr 4:6 \ft Probably a castor oil plant, though some have suggested some type of gourd plant \f* and he made it grow up over Jonah to be a shade over his head, to save him from his discomfort. And Jonah ⸤was very glad⸥\f + \fr 4:6 \ft Literally “was glad with great joy” \f* about the plant.
So God appointed a worm ⸤at daybreak⸥\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Literally “at the coming up of the dawn” \f* the next day, and it attacked the plant, and it withered.

⸤And when the sun rose⸥,\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “and it happened at the rising of the sun” \f* God appointed a scorching east wind, and the sun beat down on Jonah’s head and he grew faint. ⸤And he asked that he could die⸥\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “and he asked his soul to die” \f* and said, “My death \add is\add* better than my life!”

So God said to Jonah, “⸤Is it right for you to be angry⸥\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Literally “rightfully is it hot for you”; some take this to mean “Are you so very angry?” (\fqa Targum \ft \xt Jonah 4:4; \ft see also JPS, NEB, NET) \f* about the plant?” And he said, “⸤It is right for me to be angry enough to die⸥!”\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Literally “Rightfully it is hot for me until death” \f*

But Yahweh said, “You are troubled about the plant, for which you did not labor nor cause it to grow. ⸤It grew up in a night and it perished in a night⸥!\f + \fr 4:10 \ft Literally “Which was a son of a night and \fq as \ft a son of a night it perished” \f*

And should I not be concerned about Nineveh, the great city, ⸤in which there are⸥\f + \fr 4:11 \ft Literally “which there are in it” \f* more ⸤than one hundred and twenty thousand⸥\f + \fr 4:11 \ft Literally “than two ten myriad” (12 x 10,000) \f* people who do not know right from left,\f + \fr 4:11 \ft “\fq hand \ft ” is often supplied, but it is not clear just what deficiency is meant by this expression, which occurs only here in biblical Hebrew \f* plus many animals?”
